level_1.name: Illinois Courts - Child Support
level_1.description: General information about child support in Illinois

level_2.name: Illinois Legal Aid Online - Family Safety
level_2.description: Self-help resources and forms for child support and family matters

level_3.name: Chicago Advocate Legal, NFP
level_3.description: Provides legal assistance for child support matters in Cook County. Office located at 211 W. Wacker Dr., Ste. 200B, Chicago, IL 60606.
level_3.intake_instructions: Visit their website and click on 'Intake Form' or 'Contact Us'. If the form doesn't load, please call their intake phone number.

level_3.name: Prairie State Legal Services
level_3.description: Free legal services for eligible low-income Illinois residents
level_3.intake_instructions: Visit their website to find intake information or call for assistance.

level_3.name: Legal Aid Chicago
level_3.description: Free legal help for low-income Cook County residents
level_3.intake_instructions: Visit their website to apply online or find contact information for intake.

level_3.name: CARPLS (Coordinated Advice & Referral Program for Legal Services)
level_3.description: Provides advice and referrals to legal services in Cook County. Office located at 17 N. State St., Ste. 1850, Chicago, IL 60602.
level_3.intake_instructions: Call their hotline for legal issue intake. The website contact form is for general inquiries only, not legal intake.

level_3.name: Justice Entrepreneurs Project
level_3.description: Connects clients with affordable legal services from solo practitioners and small firms. Office located at 211 W. Wacker Dr., Ste. 200B, Chicago, IL 60606.
level_3.intake_instructions: Complete their online intake form to connect with a lawyer for review of your case.

level_1.name: Illinois Legal Aid Online - School and Education
level_1.description: Online resources, presentations, and self-help information for school and education issues

level_1.name: Legal Advocacy Resources PDF
level_1.description: Download comprehensive education law help guide with contact information for all Illinois education legal resources

level_2.name: Illinois Legal Aid Online - School and Education
level_2.description: Online resources, presentations, and self-help information for school and education issues

level_2.name: Legal Advocacy Resources PDF
level_2.description: Download comprehensive education law help guide with contact information for all Illinois education legal resources

level_3.name: Equip for Equality
level_3.description: Legal aid for special education, restraint and seclusion, discrimination/ADA rights. Multiple office locations across Illinois.
level_3.intake_instructions: Call their Special Education Helpline at 1-866-KIDS-046 (1-866-543-7046) or main office. Also serves Central Illinois (217) 544-0464 and Southern Illinois (618) 457-7930.

level_3.name: Chicago Lawyers' Committee for Civil Rights
level_3.description: Provides legal assistance for education equity issues including school discipline and civil rights matters.
level_3.intake_instructions: Visit their Education Equity page or call for assistance with discipline and education civil rights issues.

level_3.name: Legal Aid Chicago
level_3.description: Free legal help for discipline, special education, and other education issues for Cook County residents.
level_3.intake_instructions: Call their office for intake or visit their website to apply for services.

level_3.name: Stand Up For Each Other (SUFEO)
level_3.description: Provides assistance with discipline, special education, bullying, and other student rights issues.
level_3.intake_instructions: Contact by phone or visit their Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/SUFEOChicago/

level_3.name: Land of Lincoln Legal Aid
level_3.description: Provides legal help for discipline, special education, and disabilities-related education issues across Illinois.
level_3.intake_instructions: Call their Education Law Legal Advice and Referral Center or visit their Education Law page.

level_3.name: Moran Center for Youth Advocacy
level_3.description: Education Advocacy Program for students in Evanston/Skokie or Rogers Park neighborhood schools. Handles discipline, special education, and bullying cases.
level_3.intake_instructions: Note: Education Advocacy Program serves students who attend schools in Evanston/Skokie or Rogers Park neighborhood of Chicago.

level_3.name: Illinois Guardianship and Advocacy Commission (IGAC)
level_3.description: Legal advocacy for disabilities and special education issues through their Legal Advocacy Service and Special Education Initiative.
level_3.intake_instructions: Contact their statewide general information line or visit their Special Education Initiative page.

level_3.name: Legal Council for Health Justice
level_3.description: Provides assistance with special education and early intervention matters.
level_3.intake_instructions: Call their office for intake information.

level_3.name: Chicago Coalition to End Homelessness
level_3.description: Provides legal representation for youth experiencing homelessness and educational rights issues. Law Project available.
level_3.intake_instructions: Call the Law Project at (800) 940-1119 for legal assistance or visit their Educational Rights page.

level_3.name: Cabrini Green Legal Aid
level_3.description: Provides legal assistance for criminal issues related to students.
level_3.intake_instructions: Call their office for intake.

level_3.name: Chicago Advocate Legal, NFP
level_3.description: Legal assistance for education matters in Cook County. Office located at 211 W. Wacker Dr., Ste. 200B, Chicago, IL 60606.
level_3.intake_instructions: Visit their website and click on 'Intake Form' or 'Contact Us'. If the form doesn't load, please call their intake phone number.

level_3.name: Greater Chicago Legal Clinic
level_3.description: Provides legal services including education law assistance. Office located at 17 N. State St., Ste. 1710, Chicago, IL 60602. 24-hour intake voicemail available.
level_3.intake_instructions: Visit 'How Can I Get Help' page on their website to apply online via Illinois Legal Aid Online for eligible case types, or call their 24-hour intake line.

level_3.name: Legal Advocacy Resources PDF
level_3.description: Download comprehensive guide with complete contact information for all Illinois education legal resources

level_3.name: Greater Chicago Legal Clinic
level_3.description: Provides legal services for housing issues including eviction defense. Office located at 17 N. State St., Ste. 1710, Chicago, IL 60602. 24-hour intake voicemail available.
level_3.intake_instructions: Visit 'How Can I Get Help' page on their website to apply online via Illinois Legal Aid Online for eligible case types, or call their 24-hour intake line.

level_3.name: Prairie State Legal Services
level_3.description: Free legal services for housing issues
level_3.intake_instructions: Visit their website to find intake information or call for assistance.

level_3.name: Legal Aid Chicago
level_3.description: Free legal help for housing problems in Cook County
level_3.intake_instructions: Visit their website to apply online or find contact information for intake.

level_3.name: CARPLS (Coordinated Advice & Referral Program for Legal Services)
level_3.description: Provides advice and referrals for housing legal services in Cook County. Office located at 17 N. State St., Ste. 1850, Chicago, IL 60602.
level_3.intake_instructions: Call their hotline for legal issue intake. The website contact form is for general inquiries only, not legal intake.
